intro: Thlaspi tatrense, commonly known as the Tatran Bittercress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine soils and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Thlaspi tatrense is often found in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to cold climates.
